intro: Anisantha rigida, commonly known as the rigid anisantha, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and rigid, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Anisantha rigida is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental value.
